property.name: instructions
property.value:
Practice Round Instructions

You will now have {self.duration} seconds to practice with the experimental environment. The decisions you make in this round will not affect your earnings. At the beginning of the practice round {initialDistribution} of the cells are occupied with green tokens. The environment is a {self.resourceWidth} x {self.resourceDepth} grid of cells.

During this practice round, and only during this practice round, you will be able to reset the tokens displayed on the screen by pressing the R key. When you press the R key you will reset the distribution of the tokens to once again randomly occupy {initialDistribution} of the cells with tokens.

If you have any questions please raise your hand. Do you have any questions so far?

property.name: facilitator-instructions
property.value:
This facilitator interface allows you to control the experiment. In general you will be following a sequence similar to this:

  1. Show instructions
  2. Start round
  3. After round is over
    1. show trust game if necessary
    2. start standalone chat round if necessary
  4. Goto 1.

property.name: client-debriefing
property.value:
{if (self.practiceRound)}Practice Round{else}Round {self.roundIndexLabel}{endif} Results

  • Tokens collected in this round: {clientData.currentTokens}
  • Income from tokens collected: {clientData.currentIncome}
  • Quiz earnings: {clientData.quizEarnings}
  • Show up payment: {showUpPayment}
{if (showExitInstructions && !clientData.trustGameLog.empty) }

Trust Game Earnings

    {clientData.trustGameLog: {trustGameLog|
  • Trust Game #{i}: {trustGameLog}
    • }}
Your total trust game earnings: {clientData.trustGameEarnings}. {endif}

Total Income

Your total income is {clientData.grandTotalIncome}.

{if (showExitInstructions)}

Exit Survey

This was the last round, but not the end of the experiment. We ask that you please carefully fill out a brief survey as we prepare your payments.

Payment

When payments are ready we will call you up one by one. Please wait until your computer number, {clientData.id}, is called to turn in your survey and receive payment. Please answer the survey carefully and thank you for participating.

NOTE: Please answer the survey completely (there may be a back side) and bring all your belongings with you when you come up to receive your payment to help us speed up the payment process.

{endif}

property.name: trust-game-instructions
property.value:
Instructions

You will now participate in an exercise where you will be matched with a random person in your group. In this exercise there are two roles, Player 1 and Player 2. Your job is to design strategies for both Player 1 and Player 2 roles. When you are randomly paired with another member of your group you may be selected as Player 1 or Player 2. The results of randomly pairing your strategies with the other group member's strategies will be shown to you at the end of the experiment.

How to participate

  1. Player 1 will first receive an endowment of one dollar and has to decide how much to keep. The remaining amount is sent to Player 2.
  2. The amount Player 1 sends to Player 2 is tripled by the system and then given to Player 2. Player 2 must then decide how much to keep and how much to send back to Player 1.

For example, if Player 1 sends 0 cents to Player 2, Player 1 earns 1 dollar and Player 2 earns 0 cents. However, if Player 1 sends 1 dollar to Player 2, 3 dollars would be sent to Player 2. Player 2 then decides to return $1.75 back to Player 1. In this case, Player 1 earns $1.75, and Player 2 earns $1.25.

Please fill in the following form to design your strategies as Player 1 or Player 2.
If you have any questions, please raise your hand. Are there any questions?

property.name: facilitator-debriefing
property.value:
Round {self.roundIndexLabel} results

{clientDataList: {data | }}
ParticipantCurrent tokensCurrent incomeQuiz earningsTrust game earningsTotal income
{data.id}{data.currentTokens}{data.currentIncome}{data.quizEarnings}{data.trustGameEarnings}{data.grandTotalIncome}

property.name: same-as-previous-round-instructions
property.value:
Round {self.roundIndexLabel} Instructions

Round {self.roundIndexLabel} is the same as the previous round.

The length of this round is {self.duration} seconds.

Please raise your hand if you have any questions.

property.name: chat-instructions
property.value:
You can chat with the other participants in your group during this round. You may discuss any aspect of the experiment with the other participants in your group with two exceptions:

  1. You may not promise side-payments after the experiment is completed or threaten anyone with any consequence after the experiment is finished.
  2. You may not reveal your actual identity

We are monitoring the chat traffic while you chat. If we detect any violation of the rules we will have to stop the experiment and remove the offending group from the room.

You will see other participants labeled from A to {self.lastChatHandle} in the chat window. You can send a chat message by typing into the textfield and pressing the enter key.

property.name: general-instructions
property.value:
General Instructions

You will appear on the screen as a blue circle . You can move by pressing the four arrow keys on your keyboard to move up, down, left, or right. You must press a key for each and every move. As you move around you can collect tokens and earn {dollarsPerToken} for each collected token. To collect a token, move your avatar over it and press the space bar. Simply moving your avatar over a token does not collect that token.

property.name: field-of-vision-instructions
property.value: Your vision is limited in this experiment. The area that is visible to you will be shaded.

property.name: welcome-instructions
property.value:
Welcome

Welcome to the experiment. The experiment will begin shortly.

Please wait quietly and do not close this window, open any other applications, or communicate with any of the other participants.

property.name: instructions
property.value:
Instructions for Round {self.roundIndexLabel}

The length of each of the following {self.repeat} rounds is {self.duration} seconds. As in the practice round you can collect green tokens. However, this time you will earn {dollarsPerToken} lab dollars for each token collected. You cannot reset the distribution of green tokens.

On the top right corner of the screen you can see how many tokens you have collected. On the top left corner of the screen you can see the amount of time remaining in the round.

If you have any questions please raise your hand.

property.name: quiz-results
property.value:
Quiz Results

{if (allCorrect)} You have answered all the questions correctly and earned {totalQuizEarnings} in lab dollars. {else} You answered {numberCorrect} out of {totalQuestions} questions correctly and earned {totalQuizEarnings} in lab dollars. Questions you've answered incorrectly are highlighted in red. Please see below for more details. {endif}


Q1. Tokens grow from the middle of the screen.
{incorrect_q1} This statement is false. Tokens only regenerate when there are other tokens present in their immediately neighboring cells. They do not spontaneously generate from the middle of the screen.

Q2. In order to collect a token you need to press the space bar while your avatar is on a cell with a token.
{incorrect_q2} This statement is true. You must press the space bar when your avatar is on a cell with a token to collect that token.

Q3. When you have collected all tokens on the screen, no new tokens will appear.
{incorrect_q3} This statement is true. Tokens can only regenerate if there are other tokens present in their immediately neighboring cells.

Q4. Your decisions of where to collect tokens affects the regeneration of tokens.
{incorrect_q4} This statement is true. The chance that a new token will appear in an empty cell is greatest when the eight cells surrounding that empty cell all have tokens.

Q5. Is the following sequence possible?
{incorrect_q5} Yes, this sequence is possible. New tokens can regenerate on an empty cell when neighboring cells have existing tokens.

Q6. Is the following sequence possible?
{incorrect_q6} No, this sequence is not possible. New tokens cannot regenerate on an empty cell when all neighboring cells are also empty.

Q7. If each token is worth $0.02 and you collect 100 tokens in a round, you have earned 3 dollars in that round.
{incorrect_q7} This statement is false. You would have earned 100 * $0.02 = $2.00 in that round.

Q8. The duration of a round is {self.duration} seconds.
{incorrect_q8} This statement is true. The round will last {self.duration} seconds.

Q9. All the cells are filled with green tokens at the start of the experiment.
{incorrect_q9} This statement is false. At the beginning of each round, 25% of the cells will be filled with green tokens.

Q10. The amount of tokens you can earn only depends on how fast you collect the tokens.
{incorrect_q10} This statement is false. The amount of tokens you can earn depends on how you manage your tokens, not how fast you collect them.

property.name: quiz-instructions
property.value:
Changes to the Experimental Environment

We will now make a change to the environment, namely the regeneration of tokens. New tokens can now reappear in empty cells. The rate at which new tokens appear depends on the number of adjacent cells with tokens. The more tokens in the eight cells that surround an empty cell, the faster a new token will appear on that empty cell. In other words, existing tokens can generate new tokens. To illustrate this, please refer to Image 1 and Image 2. The middle cell in Image 1 denoted with an X has a greater chance of regeneration than the middle cell in Image 2. When all neighboring cells are empty, there is no chance for regeneration.

Image 1 Image 2

Best Strategy

The chance that a token will regenerate on an empty cell increases as there are more tokens surrounding it. The best arrangement of tokens that maximizes overall regrowth is the checkerboard diagram shown below.

Quiz

Before we begin the actual round please answer the following 10 statements. You have five minutes to answer these questions and you will get {quizCorrectAnswerReward} lab dollars for each correct answer. When you are finished please click submit.


Q1. Tokens grow from the middle of the screen.
True
False


Q2. In order to collect a token you need to press the space bar while your avatar is on a cell with a token.
True
False


Q3. When you have collected all tokens on the screen, no new tokens will appear.
True
False


Q4. Your decisions of where to collect tokens affects the regeneration of tokens.
True
False


Q5. Is this sequence possible?
Possible
Impossible


Q6. Is this sequence possible?
Possible
Impossible


Q7. If each token is worth 0.02 lab dollars and you collect 100 tokens in a round, you have earned 3 lab dollars in that round.
True
False


Q8. The duration of a round is {self.duration} seconds.
True
False


Q9. All the cells are filled with green tokens at the start of the experiment.
True
False


Q10. The amount of tokens you can earn only depends on how fast you collect the tokens.
True
False

On the top right corner of the screen you can see how many tokens you have collected. On the top left corner of the screen you can see the amount of time remaining in the round.

If you have any questions please raise your hand.
